text: <a href="../1-Timothy-5-1/" title="1 Timothy 5:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Rebuke not an elder, but intreat *him* as a father; *and* the younger men as brethren;
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-2/" title="1 Timothy 5:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-3/" title="1 Timothy 5:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 Honour widows that are widows indeed.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-4/" title="1 Timothy 5:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-5/" title="1 Timothy 5:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-6/" title="1 Timothy 5:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-7/" title="1 Timothy 5:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-8/" title="1 Timothy 5:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-9/" title="1 Timothy 5:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man,

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-10/" title="1 Timothy 5:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints' feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-11/" title="1 Timothy 5:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-12/" title="1 Timothy 5:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-13/" title="1 Timothy 5:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And withal they learn *to be* idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-14/" title="1 Timothy 5:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-15/" title="1 Timothy 5:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 For some are already turned aside after Satan.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-16/" title="1 Timothy 5:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-17/" title="1 Timothy 5:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-18/" title="1 Timothy 5:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourer *is* worthy of his reward.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-19/" title="1 Timothy 5:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-20/" title="1 Timothy 5:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-21/" title="1 Timothy 5:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 I charge *thee* before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.
<a href="../1-Timothy-5-22/" title="1 Timothy 5:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men's sins: keep thyself pure.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-23/" title="1 Timothy 5:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach's sake and thine often infirmities.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-24/" title="1 Timothy 5:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 Some men's sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some *men* they follow after.

<a href="../1-Timothy-5-25/" title="1 Timothy 5:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 Likewise also the good works *of some* are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.
